an10.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an10.1:1.3: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an10.1:2.1: “Sir, what is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics?”
an10.1:2.2: “Ānanda, having no regrets is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics.”
an10.1:3.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of having no regrets?”
an10.1:3.2: “Joy is the purpose and benefit of having no regrets.”
an10.1:4.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of joy?”
an10.1:5.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of rapture?”
an10.1:6.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of tranquility?”
an10.1:7.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of bliss?”
an10.1:8.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of immersion?”
an10.1:9.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing?”
an10.1:10.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion?”
an10.1:10.2: “Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.1:11.1: So, Ānanda, the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics is not having regrets.
an10.1:11.2: Joy is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
an10.1:11.3: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of joy.
an10.1:11.4: Tranquility is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
an10.1:11.5: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquility.
an10.1:11.6: Immersion is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
an10.1:11.7: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of immersion.
an10.1:11.8: Disillusionment and dispassion is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing.
an10.1:11.9: Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.1:11.10: So, Ānanda, skillful ethics progressively lead up to the highest.”
